tree

Class ProbFunTree<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.ProbFunTree<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the elements that will be picked from
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ProbFunTree<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A tree node where a set of elements are picked from randomly to decide which child will randomly produce the next element when fun() is called.
    Since:
    Copyright 2020
    Author:
    Alexander Johnston
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProbFunTree(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> probMap, int layers)
      Creates a ProbFunTree where getting a key from this ProbFunTree's fun() function is based on the probability values.
      ProbFunTree(java.util.Set<T> choices, int layers)
      Creates a ProbFunTree where there is an equal chance of getting any element from choices when fun() in called.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLayer(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> probMap)
      Adds probMap keys to a new layer that will be added to this ProbFunTree's descendants that have the greatest depth, making the probability of each element added equal to the values in probMap.
      void addLayer(java.util.Set<T> choices)
      Adds elements to a new layer that will be added to this ProbFunTree's descendants that have the greatest depth, making the probability of each element added equal to 1.0/n, where n is the number of elements in choices.
      void addToAll(T element)
      Adds an element to every node in this ProbFunTree, making the probability equal to 1.0/n where n is the number of elements contained in this ProbFunTree.
      void addToAll(T element, double percent)
      Adds an element to every node in this ProbFunTree with the specified probability.
      void bad(java.util.List<T> elements, double percent)
      Adjust the probabilities to make the elements less likely to be returned when fun() is called in the order they appear in elements.
      double bad(T element, double percent)
      Adjust the probability to make element less likely to be returned when fun() is called from the parent of this ProbFunTree.
      void clearHistory()
      Due to propagation of past values, history may not produce favorable results, therefore this method clears the history, but not the probabilities produced by feedback, so the next generation is way more likely to produce favorable results after good() or bad() have been called one or more times.
      void clearProbs()
      Sets the probabilities to there being an equal chance of getting any element from this ProbFunTree
      ProbFunTree<T> clone() 
      T fun()
      Returns a randomly picked element from this ProbFunTree, based on the previously returned elements.

      the Map of element-probability pairs that make up the parent of this ProbFunTree.

      Adjust the probabilities to make the elements more likely to be returned when fun() is called in the order they appear in elements.

      Adjust the probability to make element more likely to be returned when fun() is called from the parent of this ProbFunTree.
      int hashCode() 
      int parentSize()
      Returns the number of elements in the parent of this ProbFunTree.

      Removes elements with probabilities less than or equal to percent of being generated from this ProbFunTree.
      void removeFromAll(T element)
      Removes an element from every node in this ProbFunTree.
      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this whole ProbFunTree, which includes the number of elements in the parent plus the number of elements in every descendant.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProbFunTree

        public ProbFunTree(java.util.Set<T> choices,
                   int layers)
        Creates a ProbFunTree where there is an equal chance of getting any element from choices when fun() in called. Note that the elements in choices passed into this constructor will NOT be copied and will be added by reference.
        Parameters:
        choices - as the choices to be randomly picked from.
        layers - as the number of layers for this ProbFunTree to generate. Ex: for choices[0, 1] and layers=2, the following data structure will be made,
        [[0->0.5][1->0.5]] where the first choice is propagated like so [[0->[[0->0.5][1->0.5]]][1->[[0->0.5][1->0.5]]]].
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if choices is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there isn't at least one element in choices, or layers is not at least 1.

      • ProbFunTree

        public ProbFunTree(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> probMap,
                   int layers)
        Creates a ProbFunTree where getting a key from this ProbFunTree's fun() function is based on the probability values. The entries in probMap passed into this constructor will NOT be copied and will be added by reference.
        Parameters:
        probMap - as the Object-probability pairs where the probabilities must add up to 1.0 using double addition.
        layers - as the number of layers for this ProbFunTree to generate. Ex: for probMap [0->0.25, 1->0.75] and layers=2, the following data structure will be made,
        [[0->0.25][1->0.75]] where the first choice is propagated like so [[0->[[0->0.25][1->0.75]]][1->[[0->0.25][1->0.75]]]].
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if probMap is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there isn't at least one entry in probMap, probMap values do not add up to 1.0 using double addition, or layers is not at least 1.

    • Method Detail

      • getParentMap

        public java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> getParentMap()
        the Map of element-probability pairs that make up the parent of this ProbFunTree. Any changes in the returned Map will be reflected in this ProbFunTree.
        Returns:
        the Map of element-probability pairs that make up the parent of this ProbFunTree. Any changes in the returned Map will be reflected in this ProbFunTree.

      • getChildMap

        public java.util.Map<T,ProbFunTree<T>> getChildMap()
        Returns the Map of element-ProbFunTree pairs that make up the children of this ProbFunTree. Any changes in the returned Map will be reflected in this ProbFunTree.
        Returns:
        the Map of element-ProbFunTree pairs that make up the children of this ProbFunTree. Any changes in the returned Map will be reflected in this ProbFunTree.

      • clearProbs

        public void clearProbs()
        Sets the probabilities to there being an equal chance of getting any element from this ProbFunTree

      • clearHistory

        public void clearHistory()
        Due to propagation of past values, history may not produce favorable results, therefore this method clears the history, but not the probabilities produced by feedback, so the next generation is way more likely to produce favorable results after good() or bad() have been called one or more times.

      • addToAll

        public void addToAll(T element)
        Adds an element to every node in this ProbFunTree, making the probability equal to 1.0/n where n is the number of elements contained in this ProbFunTree. If the element already exists in a node, then the element will not be updated. In order to overwrite old element probabilities, you must remove the element using removeFromAll().
        Parameters:
        element - as the element to add to every node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null.

      • addToAll

        public void addToAll(T element,
                     double percent)
        Adds an element to every node in this ProbFunTree with the specified probability. If the element already exists in a node, then the element will not be updated. In order to overwrite old element probabilities, you must remove the element using removeFromAll().
        Parameters:
        element - as the element to add to every node.
        percent - between 0 and 1 exclusive, as the chance of the parent and all it's children of this ProbFunTree returning element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if percent is not between 0.0 and 1.0 (exclusive).

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(java.util.Set<T> choices)
        Adds elements to a new layer that will be added to this ProbFunTree's descendants that have the greatest depth, making the probability of each element added equal to 1.0/n, where n is the number of elements in choices.
        Parameters:
        choices - as the elements to add to this ProbFunTree's descendants that have the greatest depth.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if choices is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if choices doesn't have at least one item.

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> probMap)
        Adds probMap keys to a new layer that will be added to this ProbFunTree's descendants that have the greatest depth, making the probability of each element added equal to the values in probMap.
        Parameters:
        probMap - as the Object-probability pairs where the probabilities must add up to 1.0 using double addition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if probMap is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if probMap doesn't have at least one entry, or probMap values aren't under 1.0 using double addition.

      • removeFromAll

        public void removeFromAll(T element)
        Removes an element from every node in this ProbFunTree. If an node in the tree has only 1 element, then element will not be removed that that specific node.
        Parameters:
        element - as the element to remove from every node in this ProbFunTree.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null.

      • purgeAll

        public void purgeAll()
        Removes elements with the lowest probabilities in this ProbFunTree. If elements have the same maximum probability of occurring, no elements will be removed. If, after a removal, elements have the same maximum probability of occurring, no elements will be removed. If a node has one element, no elements will be removed. If a node has one element after a removal, no more elements will be removed.

      • purgeAll

        public void purgeAll(double percent)
        Removes elements with probabilities less than or equal to percent of being generated from this ProbFunTree. If a node has one element, no elements will be removed. If a node has one element after a removal, no more elements will be removed.
        Parameters:
        percent - as the upper limit, inclusive, of the probability of elements being returned to be removed from this ProbFunTree.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if percent is not between 0.0 and 1.0 (exclusive)

      • good

        public double good(T element,
                   double percent)
        Adjust the probability to make element more likely to be returned when fun() is called from the parent of this ProbFunTree.
        Parameters:
        element - as the element to make appear more often
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 (exclusive), of the probability of getting element to add to the probability.
        Returns:
        the adjusted probability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive.

      • good

        public void good(java.util.List<T> elements,
                 double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make the elements more likely to be returned when fun() is called in the order they appear in elements.
        Parameters:
        elements - as the elements to make appear more often in the order they should appear in.
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 (exclusive), of the probabilities of getting the elements to add to the probabilities.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if elements is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive or elements is empty.

      • bad

        public double bad(T element,
                  double percent)
        Adjust the probability to make element less likely to be returned when fun() is called from the parent of this ProbFunTree.
        Parameters:
        element - as the element to make appear less often
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 (exclusive), of the probability of getting element to subtract from the probability.
        Returns:
        the adjusted probability.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if element is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive.

      • bad

        public void bad(java.util.List<T> elements,
                double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make the elements less likely to be returned when fun() is called in the order they appear in elements.
        Parameters:
        elements - as the elements to make appear less often in the order they should not appear in.
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 (exclusive), of the probabilities of getting the elements to subtract from the probabilities.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if elements is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive or elements is empty.

      • fun

        public T fun()
        Returns a randomly picked element from this ProbFunTree, based on the previously returned elements.
        Returns:
        a randomly picked element from this ProbFunTree. Any changes in the element will be reflected in this ProbFunTree.

      • parentSize

        public int parentSize()
        Returns the number of elements in the parent of this ProbFunTree.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in the parent of this ProbFunTree.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements in this whole ProbFunTree, which includes the number of elements in the parent plus the number of elements in every descendant.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in this whole ProbFunTree, which includes the number of elements in the parent plus the number of elements in every descendant.
